Package test

Class Wall

java.lang.Object
test.Wall
public class Wall
extends java.lang.Object
This class is responsible for the impacts between game components and how they affect certain scores.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean ballEnd()
    This method is used to check if all the balls are lost.
    void ballReset()
    This method is used to respawn a ball and re-randomize the balls speed when a ball is lost.
    void findImpacts()
    This method is used to identify where the ball makes an impact (The player bar, Wall, Frame Borders) and how the ball's movement is affected.

    Getter for the number of balls available for the level.

    Getter for the number of bricks available on the Wall.

    This is to see if the ball had gone beyond the range of the border.

    This method is used to understand the ball movement and how it causes cracks on the bricks on impact.

    This method is used to make the rubber ball object.
    void move()
    This method enables both the ball and player bar to move around.
    void nextLevel()
    This method is used to advance to the next level.
    void resetBallCount()
    This method is used to reset the ball count for a given level back to its original value.

    Setter to set the speed of the ball in X-axis.
    void setBallYSpeed​(int s)
    Setter to set the speed of the ball in Y-axis.
    void wallReset()
    This method is used to Reset the wall structure and form the bricks again, it also resets the number of balls to its original value.

  • Constructor Details

    • Wall

      public Wall​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea, int brickCount, int lineCount, double brickDimensionRatio, java.awt.Point ballPos)
      This is the constructor for the Wall class. XXXX
      Parameters:
      drawArea - drawArea is the Rectangle in which the whole game is being setup.
      brickCount - this represents the total number of bricks on the brick wall.
      lineCount - this represents the number of brick lines on the wall.
      brickDimensionRatio - this represents the height to width ratio of a singular brick.
      ballPos - this represents the position of the ball.

  • Method Details

    • makeBall

      private void makeBall​(java.awt.geom.Point2D ballPos)
      This method is used to make the rubber ball object.
      Parameters:
      ballPos - Represents the Point2D position of the ball.

    • move

      public void move()
      This method enables both the ball and player bar to move around.

    • findImpacts

      public void findImpacts()
      This method is used to identify where the ball makes an impact (The player bar, Wall, Frame Borders) and how the ball's movement is affected.

    • impactWall

      private boolean impactWall()
      This method is used to understand the ball movement and how it causes cracks on the bricks on impact.
      Returns:
      Returns a boolean value depending on whether the ball made impact with the wall or not (true if impact, else false).

    • impactBorder

      private boolean impactBorder()
      This is to see if the ball had gone beyond the range of the border.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the ball had gone beyond the range of the border.

    • getBrickCount

      public int getBrickCount()
      Getter for the number of bricks available on the Wall.
      Returns:
      Returns the number of bricks available on the Wall.

    • getBallCount

      public int getBallCount()
      Getter for the number of balls available for the level.
      Returns:
      Returns Int, the number of balls available for the level.

    • isBallLost

      public boolean isBallLost()
      Method to identify if a ball was lost in a level.
      Returns:
      Returns true if ball was lost, else false.

    • ballReset

      public void ballReset()
      This method is used to respawn a ball and re-randomize the balls speed when a ball is lost.

    • wallReset

      public void wallReset()
      This method is used to Reset the wall structure and form the bricks again, it also resets the number of balls to its original value.

    • ballEnd

      public boolean ballEnd()
      This method is used to check if all the balls are lost.
      Returns:
      Returns true if all balls are lost, else returns false.

    • isDone

      public boolean isDone()
      This method is used to check if all the bricks are broken.
      Returns:
      Returns true if all bricks are broken, else returns false.

    • nextLevel

      public void nextLevel()
      This method is used to advance to the next level.

    • hasLevel

      public boolean hasLevel()
      This method is used to check if there are more levels left to advance.
      Returns:
      Returns true if there are more levels available, else returns false.

    • setBallXSpeed

      public void setBallXSpeed​(int s)
      Setter to set the speed of the ball in X-axis.
      Parameters:
      s - refers to the speed of ball we want to set in X-axis.

    • setBallYSpeed

      public void setBallYSpeed​(int s)
      Setter to set the speed of the ball in Y-axis.
      Parameters:
      s - refers to the speed of ball we want to set in Y-axis.

    • resetBallCount

      public void resetBallCount()
      This method is used to reset the ball count for a given level back to its original value.
